   12:  The formation of an additional layer in the equatorial topside ionosphere
   14:  1137-1140
   30:  Advances in Space Research
   31:  20
   32:  6
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DAE
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1997>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  AERONOMIA
   87:  plasmasfera
   87:  ionosfera
   87:  regi‰es tropicais
   87:  camada de plasma
   87:  regi∆o F
   88:  plasmaphere
   88:  ionosphere
   88:  tropical regions
   88:  plasma layers
   88:  F region
   80:  
   83:  Calculations using the Sheffield University plasmasphere ionosphere model have shown that under certain conditions an additional layer can form in the low latitude topside ionosphere. This layer (the F3 layer) has subsequently been observed in ionograms recorded at Fortaleza in Brazil. It has not been observed in ionograms recorded at the neighbouring station, Sao Luis. Model calculations have shown that the F3 layer is most likely to form in summer at Fortaleza due to a combination of the neutral wind and the E x B drift acting to raise the plasma. At Fortaleza the horizontal wind moves the plasma up the inclined field lines; at Sao Luis the field lines are nearly horizontal and the wind cannot raise the plasma further

   10:  Yelisetty, Viswanadham
   10:  Silva Filho, Vicente de Paula

   12:  The Priestley-Taylor parameter alfa for the Amazon Forest
   14:  211-225
   30:  Forest Ecology and Management Journal
   31:  38
   32:  3-4
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DCM
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1991>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  CIENCIAS METEOROLOGICAS
   87:  MICROMETEOROLOGIA
   87:  BALANCO ENERGETICO
   87:  PARAMETRIZACAO
   82:  <FLORESTA AMAZONICA>
   82:  <RESERVA FLORESTAL DE DUCKE>
   83:   Priestley and Taylor provided a practical formulation of the partitioning of net radiation between heat flux and evaporation contained within a parameter alfa . Their model (PTM) needs verification under a range of environmetal condition. Micrometeorological data sets collected over the Amazon forest at the Ducke Reserve site (2 degrees 57'S; 59 degrees 57'W) gave an opportunity to evaluate alfa. Evidence presented here and by others shows that there is pronounced diurnal variation in alfa, with minimum values around midday and maximum values in the morning and evening hours. During unstable and stable conditions in the daylight hours, the Bowen ratio (B) varied from 0.10 to 0.57 and -0.71 to -0.08, respectively, whereas alfa varied from 0.67 to 1.16 and 1.28 to 3.12, respectively. A mean value of alfa =1.16 more or less 0.56 was obtained from daytime hourly values for two days. The daily data sets from three expeditions gave a mean of alfa=1.03 more or less 0.13. This work confirms that alfa is a function of atmospheric stability over the Amazon forest. Thus the PTM should be applied with caution over time-intervals of one day or less because of the sensitivity to variation in alfa. The calculated values of alfa are in general agreement with those reported in literature
   91:  FDB-19900315
   92:  FDB-MLR
   92:  MHM

   10:  Gan, Manoel Alonso

   12:  Surface cyclogenesis over South America
   14:  1293-1302
   30:  Monthly Weather Review
   31:  119
   32:  5
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DCM
   61:  <PI>
   64:  May <1991>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDO DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   87:  CLIMATOLOGIA DINAMICA
   87:  CICLOGENESES
   82:  <AMERICA DO SUL>
   83:   The frequency of surface cyclogenesis over South America (approximately the area enclosed by 15 degrees - 50 degrees S and 30 degrees - 90 degrees W) has been calculated using 10 years (1979-1988) of data. The frequency of cyclogenesis is more in winter than in any other season. Highest frequency (139) is found in the month of May and the lowest frequency(71) is found in the month of December. In addition to seasonal variation, the frequency of cyclogenesis shows interannual variation. The occurrence of cyclogenesis is more during the years of negative Southern Oscillation index (EL Nino years) and less during the years of positive Southern Oscilation index. The years of higher (lower) cyclogenesis are found to be associated with higher (lower) rainfall. This explains the negative correlation between the precipitation over southern Brazil and the Southern  Oscillation index
   91:  FDB-19900424

   12:  The influence of the Andes Cordillera on transient disturbances
   14:  1141-1157
   30:  Monthly Weather Review
   31:  122
   32:  6
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DCM
   61:  <PI>
   64:  June <1994>
   67:  BR
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDO DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   87:  CLIMATOLOGIA DINAMICA
   87:  DISTURBIOS TRANSIENTES
   82:  <CORDILHEIRA DOS ANDES>
   83:    The influence of the Andes Cordillera on transient disturbances is investigated in this study using a lagcorrelation analysis. This analysis shows that the unfiltered geopotential height data have a wavelike pattern moving to the east while tilting to the west in the vertical. When the wave approaches the Andes Cordillera, it exhibits orographic effects such as anticyclonic turning of a low-level disturbance trajectory, a zonal trajectory in the upper levels, distortions of the isolines of correlation, and an elongation of maximum correlation on the lee side of the Andes. The anticyclonic turning of the trajectory in the low-altitude level and a zonal trajectory in upper levels implies a decrease in the vertical tilt of the system on the windward side and an increase in the tilt on the lee side. The increase of baroclinicity on the lee side results in baroclinic development as predicted from a linearly obtained normal-mode solution in the presence of mountains. A cross-correlation analysis of the high-pass-filtered disturbances shows an eastward phase propagation and a westward vertical tilt with height on the order of one-quarter wavelength between 1000-and 300-hPa levels. The horizontal structure and phase propagation show characteristics similar to the fastest-growing baroclinic normal mode in a two-layer, quasigeostrophic, Beta-plane, linear model with a mountain placed in the north-south direction. This shows that the high-pass-filtered anomalies over the South American region are associated with baroclinic disturbances influenced by the Andes Cordillera. The results further show that the interaction of these anomalies with the Andes Cordillera is responsible for lee cyclogenesis. The composite maps show that the positive and negative high-pass-filtered anomalies have the same structure and paths of phase propagation. These anomalies intensity over the Pacific Ocean near the South American continent
   91:  FDB-19900601
   92:  FDB-MLR
   92:  MHM

   10:  Pinto Jr., Osmar

   12:  About the origin of peaks in the spectrum of inner belt electrons

   14:  1857-1860
   30:  Journal of Geophysical research
   31:  96
   32:  D2
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DGE
   61:  <PI>
   64:  Feb. <1991>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  GEOF÷SICA ESPACIAL
   83:  A power spectral analysis of geomagnetic data between June and November 1982 from Vassouras, a low-latitude observatory located in the South Atlantic Magnetic Anomaly (SAMA), is carried out in order to investigate the origin of multiple peaks commonly observed in the energetic electron spectra in the inner magnetosphere. Comparison with energetic electron observations made by the low-altitude satellite S81-1 during the same time interval [Datlowe et al., 1985] indicates that even it the peaks are due to a quasi-resonance process as Cladis [1966] has suggested, whereby energetic electrons are accelerated and transported radially as a result of magnetic fluctuations with periods comparable to their azimuthal drift periods, the driver of such magnetic fluctuations is not the ionospheric current in the equatorial electrojet, modulated by electron precipitation in the SAMA region, such as Cladis [1966] proposed. We suggest that the source of drift-resonant magnetic fluctuations, if they exist, must instead be sought in the solar wind. Otherwise, the drift-resonant mechanism cannot be viable
   91:  FDB-19900601
   92:  FDB-MLR
   92:  MHM

   12:  A satellite-based estimate of evapotranspiration over Amazonia
   14:  179-191
   30:  Remote Sensing Reviews
   31:  10
   32:  1-3
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1994>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  METEOROLOGIA POR SATELITE
   87:  MODELOS
   87:  MEDIDA
   87:  GOES
   87:  EVAPOTRANSPIRACAO
   82:  <AMAZONIA (RAGIAO)>
   83:    If rainfall, storage and flux divergence are known, evapotranspiration can be estimated as the residual in a budget of atmospheric misture. We describe a new approach to misture-budget estimates of Amazon evapotranspiration. Synoptic observations ( and numerical model analyses from the U.S. National Meteorological Center) are combined with wind, humidity and rain information retrieved from radiances measured by the Geostationary Operational Environmental Satelite (GOES). Rainfall is inferred from the thermal infrared of the Visible and Infrared Spin Scan Radiometer (VISSR). Humidity is retrieved from the VISSR Atmospheric Sounder (VAS). Winds are inferred from both VISSR and VAS images, using visible, thermal infrared and water vapor bands. Satellite and station or model informations is merged by means of a recusive filter. The GOES-budget approach was tested over a three-day period from May 1987. Our estimate of evapotranspiration over the basing, 9mm/d, is unrealistically large. A sensitivity analysis indicates that the largest part of the error originated in GOES cloud and water vapor winds and the next largest part in VAS humidity. We conclude that the approach failed in its first test. However, since the test was conducted researchers have found better algorithms for selecting cloud and water vapor targets and for assigning altitudes. In addition, simulation suggest that even in the absene of better algorithms the next generation of GOES will provide more accurate winds and humidity than the present generation. If it is supported by direct measurements of evapotranspiration, a second test of the approach might be successful
   91:  FDB-19910217
   92:  FDB-MLR
  100:  FDB-MLR

   12:  Multispectral and multitemporal optical sensor of CBERS
   14:  101-109
   18:  Proceedings
   21:  28 
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   52:  ISPRS
   53:  International Symposium on Primary Data Acquisition
   54:  24-29 jun. <1990>
   56:  Manaus
   57:  BR
   58:  ETE
   61:  <CI>
   64:  <1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  ENGENHARIA E TECNOLOGIA ESPACIAL
   87:  SATELITE SINO-BRASILEIRO DE RECURSOS TERRESTRES
   87:  CBERS
   87:  SENSORES
   83:  China-Brazil Earth Remote Sensing Satellite (CBERS) is taking shape presently, fruiftying the concept of multi-resolution imaging, spreading from visible to far infrared, backed-up by multination efforts which is more appealing than ever, replacing today's duplicate efforts in the world scanario, "shaping eyes in the shy" with a spirit of cooperation in the place of competition. These sensors are grouped in three parts, the first two being self-scanned type, and the other one is characterized by opto-mechanical scanning, and are named as HRC, WFI and MSS, the spatial resolutions of which varies over a long range of 20 to 260 meters. The WFI is a CCD Camera with wide field imaging capacity, characterized to generate low resolution ground images with a high repetitive cycle, less than five days, introducing a marco to micro imaging capacity for the CCD Payloads giving an indication of built-in zoom type facility, in conjunction with off-nadir pointing CCD High Resolution Camara (HRC). The details of the above optical sensors will be presented in this paper

   12:  The China-Brazil Earth Resources Satellite (CBERS) Program

   83:  The cooperation between Brazil and China (PRC) in the space technology is the first program in a high technology areas between developing countries. It attempts to develop space technology in both countries on a mutual benefit basis with each country being entirely responsable for its own share in the program. In this paper we present the main characteristic of  the spacecrafts being developed with special emphasis on its unique multi-sensor payload capabilities. The spacecraft carries three different imaging sensors on bord which possibilitates some new features to this class of satellites. The technologies used in designing the sensors are presented and discussed as well as performance characteristics of the imagers. A ground segment compatible with the envisage applications and users needs will be designed and implement in the future

   12:  A brazilian satellite to observe and monitor the Amazon region
   14:  56-60
   30:  Mouvelle Revue Aeronautique Astronautique
   31:  6
   32:  :
   40:  En
   41:  Em
   42:  <E><WEBSCI>

   90:  b
   83:  Interest in amazon rain-forest satellite monitoring has been growing in recent years as a consequence of the worldwide recognition of the ecological and economical importance of that region the increasing needs for both spatial and temporal resolutions in remote sensing applications such as the monitoring of deforestation, forest-fire, river flooding and desertification activities, directed the efforts of the Brazilian government and the Brazilian Space Agency (AEB) towards the development of the SSR (remote sensing satellite) mission, described in this paper along with the ssr satellite main features this mission consists in the observation of the Amazon region by a small satellite (about 250 kg) in a circular (about 900 km height), equatorial orbit

   16:  Alvala, Plinio Carlos
   18:  Observacoes do metano atmosferico no Brasil
   20:  126
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Doutor
   58:  SPG
   58:  DGE
   59:  GES
   62:  INPE
   64:  nov. <1995>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  GEOFISICA ESPACIAL
   87:  METANO
   87:  BAIXA TROPOSFERA
   87:  CICLO BIOGEOQUIMICO
   83:    Apresentam-se as primeiras medidas Sistematicas do metano atomosferico (CH4) na baixa troposfera em diferentes localidades do Brasil, e o seu fluxo em uma lagoa do Pantanal Mato-Grossense. Para sua determinacao quantitativa otimizou-se um cromatografo com detector de ionizacao de chama. Comparam-se os dados da concentracao de CH4 da superficie obtidos em Natal, RN ( 6 graus S) e Cuiaba, MT ( 16 graus S) com valores obtidos por outros autores em estacoes maritimas, em latitudes proximas. As medias anuais para Natal ( 1993:1675 mais ou menos 28 ppbv, 1994:1682 mais ou menos 29 ppbv) coicidem as observadas nas estacoes maritimas, bem como o padrao de variacao sazonal, o qual mostra amplitudes apena da ordem de 1
   83:   em relacao aos vaores medios; embora os dados apresentem consideravel dispersao. A maioria das estacoes de monitoramento da rede NOAA e maritima. Para a estacao de Cuiaba observaram-se medias com valores bem superiores aos esperados para a sua latitude. Este resutado parece estar diretamente relacionado a presenca de fontes locais, tais como a queima de biomassa na estacao seca. Perfis de metano realizados na baixa troposfera, nas epocas chuvosas e seca na regiao do Cerrado, utilizando uma aeronave Bandeirante montraram um aumento na concentracao do perfil medio em Cuiaba ( 1665 mais ou menos 24ppbv na epoca chuvosa e 1717 mais ou menos 15 mppbv na epoca seca ), quando o numero de queimadas e maior, evindenciando a participacao destas na emissao de metano para a atmosfera. Finalmente, obtiveran-se medidas de fluxo de CH4 em uma lagoa de Pantanal, em duas estacoes diferentes. Os fluxos medios foram 76 mais ou menos 110 mg CH4 m-2 dia -1 (abril) e 32 mais ou menos 52 mg CH4 m-2 dia -1 ( agosto-setembro), que sao comparaveis aos fluxos encontrados em areas alagadas na Amazonia

   83:  Will man nach durchgefuhrten Bahnmanovern die neue Bahn eines Satelliten bestimmen, so sind typischerweise Trackingdaten eines ganzen Bahnumlaufs notwendig, um mit einem konventionellen Bahnbestimmungsprogramm die Bahn auf einige hundert Meter genau zu bestimmen.    18:  Interferencia entre chamas de difusao de jatos paralelos, divergentes e convergentes
   20:  117
   40:  Pt
   41:  PtEN
   42:  <E>
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas espaciais

   58:  SPC

   62:  INPE
   64:  jun. <1993>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  COMBUSTAO
   83:  Realizou-se este trabalho experimental com o objetivo de investigar a influencia da interacao entre dus chamas de difusao turbulentas de acetileno, com e sem a adicao de helio, sobre os comprimentos das mesmas. As configuracoes geometricas de jatos paralelos, convergentes e divergentes foramutilizadas neste trabalho. Dos resultados obtidos conclui-se que o comprimento de chama diminui com o aumento do angulode inclinacao dos jatos, tanto para angulos convergentes como para divergentes, e que o comprimento de chama diminui com o aumento da concentracao de helio no combustivel

   12:  Micrometeorological measurements in Amazon forest during GTE/ABLE-2A Mission
   14:  13669-13682
   30:  Journal of Geophysical Research-Atmospheres
   31:  95
   32:  D9
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E><WEBSCI>
   58:  LMO
   61:  <PI>
   64:  Aug.<1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDO DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   87:  MICROMETEOROLOGIA
   87:  TROCA DE ENERGIA
   87:  MOMENTUM
   87:  MEDIDA
   87:  GTE/ABLE 2A MISSAO
   82:  <RESERVA FLORESTAL DE DUCKE (MA)>
   82:  <FLORESTA AMAZONICA>
   83:    As part of the Global Tropospheric Experiment/Amazon Boundary Layer Experiment 2A, micrometeorological measurements were made using a 45 m scaffolding tower located in the Ducke Reserve Forest site (2 degrees 57 min S, 59 degrees 57 min W) 26 Km northeast of Manaus, Amazonas, Brazil. We report the daily variation within and above the forest of several meteorological parameters such as temperature, humidity, winds, radiation exchange, and energy partition into latent and sensible heat fluxes. Estimates of eddy diffusivity coefficients for momentum, heat, and water vapor were made using the observed profiles. These results provide information on the physical processes involved in the exchange of momentum, heat, and water vapor between the forest and the air layer above. To account for the anomalies in eddy diffusivities, a brief discussion is presented based on turbulent transport processes

   12:  Rede morfologica nao supervisionada-RMNS
   14:  400-405
   18:  Proceedings
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   53:  Brazilian Conference on Neural Network, 4
   54:  20-22 July <1999>
   56:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   57:  BR
   58:  DPI
   61:  <CN>
   64:  <1999>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  MORFOLOGIA MATEMATICA
   87:  REDES NEURAIS ARTIFICIAIS
   87:  REDE KOHONEN
   87:  REDE MORFOLOGICA
   88:  NEURAL NETS
   88:  MORPHOLOGICAL MATHEMATICS
   83:  In this work we propose a new paradigm of Artificial Neural Net (RIVA): the Unsupervised Morphologic Net (RMNS portuguese-speaking), characterized by competitive learning. this paradigm belongs to a class of translation invariant nets and it is based on gray level Mathematical Morphology (MM), Carpenter and Grossberg's ART, and Kohonen net models. In the activation phase, the template matching operator is implemented using translation invariant MM elementary operators. these operators enable a robust pattern detection with respect to addictive or subtractive noise, and lor small deformations of the patterns to be recognized. In the training phase, the RMNS uses a Kohonen learning rule variation and a reset system inspired by Carpenter and Grossberger's ART model
   91:  FDB-19920309

   82:  <MANAUS (ESTADO)>
   83:  Carbon dioxide generation rates are among the most significant parameters to evaluate and quantify the impact of forest clearing processes on the environment. These rates are calculated based on the average carbon content of the biomass and total mass obove the ground, knowing that only a certain portion of the carbon reacts to carbon dioxide and other gases. this portion is basically the combustion efficiency and depends on the type of forest, on how the trees were cut and piled, on the material size on the biomass moisture content, among others

   16:  Machado, Lucia Helena Ribas
   18:  Estudo da camada limite atmosferica por imagens de satelite Landsat
   20:  125
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  SPG
   59:  MET
   62:  INPE
   64:  ago. <1991>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  MICROMETEOROLOGIA
   87:  LANDSAT
   87:  POLUICAO DO AR
   82:  <SAO MATEUS (ES)><CABO FRIO (RJ)><GUIBA (RS)>
   83:   Analisam-se plumas de contaminantes utilizando imagens LANDSAT sobre regioes costeiras em Sao Mateus, ES (18 44'S; 39 51'W), Cabo Frio, RJ (22 59'S; 42 02'W) e Guaiba, RS (30 06'S; 51 00'W), assim como dados de radiossondagens - em conjunto com as imagens citadas ou independentemente delas - para avaliar eventos de poluicao do ar e examinar alguns principios teoticos dos fenomenos de transporte. Determinou-se o coeficiente de dispersao lateral do contaminante (Ky), utilizando a estimativa do desvio padrao lateral da distribuicao de material na pluma (sy), suposta gaussiana, obtida das imagens LANDSAT. O coeficiente de dispersao vertical do contaminante (Kz) foi determinado atraves do modelo de Weinstock (1978b, 1981), que utiliza a taxa de dissipacao de energia cinetica turbulenta (E), obtida tanto a partir de imagens LANDSAT como de dados de radiossondagem, e a frequencia de Brunt-Vaissala (N), que e calculada de dados de radiossondagem. Tambem, obtiveram-se o numero de Richardson fluxo (Rf), a escala de Ozmidov (Lo) e o numero de Richardson gradiente (Ri), este ultimo indicativo da estabilidade atmosferica. Todos estes parametros da camada limite atmosferica apresentam uma dependencia com estabilidade igual a constatada tanto em observacoes no oceano (estratificacao estavel), quanto em laboratorio (turbulencia em decaimento em escoamento estratificado), onde para Ri = RIc tem-se uma maxima mistura do contaminante; para Ri < RIc existe uma turbulencia ativa, enquanto para Ri > RIc, a flutuabilidade inibe progressivamente a turbulencia. Os valores de Ky e Kz variam respectivamente, de 10 1 a 10 2 e de 10-3 a 10 1m2s-1, para uma estratificacao estavel, enquanto para E e N obteve-se uma relacao da forma E=aNY, com y entre 0,5 e 1. Estes resultados concordam com os obtidos por outros autores sobre superficies de agua
  101:  D

MFN: 1398 

   18:  A origem interplanetaria e o desenvolvimento da fase principal das tempestades geomagneticas moderadas (1978-1979)
   20:  307
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Doutor
   58:  UPG
   58:  DGE
   59:  CEA
   62:  INPE
   64:  ago. <1992>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   83:   As tempestades geomagneticas estao associadas a corrente de anel, que e governada pela injecao de energia produzida essencialmente durante o acoplamente vento solar-magnetosfera devido a reconexao magnetica na magnetopausa. Este trabalho identificou as origens interplanetarias das tempestades geomagneticas moderadas (-100 nT < Dst-min <-50 nt) e analisou os processos de acoplamento durante a fase principal das tempestades. Para isto foram utilizadas as medidas do campo magnetico interplanetario (CMI) e da temperatura, densidade e velocidade do vento solar, obtidas pelo satelite ISEE-3, juntamente com os indices de atividade geomagnetica equatorial Dst e auroral AE, fornecidos pelo "Word Data Center", do periodo de agosto de 1978 a dezembro de 1979. Identificaram-se 78 tempestades moderadas, das quais 40 eventos de tempestades (Dst iniciando O Nt) puderam ser selecionados. Relacionados com esses eventos bem definidos, as seguintes origens interplanetarias foram encontradas: fenomenos de ejecao de massa coronal - EMC (40
   83:   dos eventos estao associados a choques interplanetarios; 22,5
   83:   a feixes simples; 17,5
   83:   a interacoes de feixes; e 10
   83:   a elevacao nao compreensiva de densidade do plasma solar) e fenomenos nao-EMC (7,5
   83:   a ondas do tipo alfavenicas e 2,5
   83:   a fenomeno nao identificado). 47
   83:   dos fenomenos EMC ocorrem proximos a lamina de corrente heliosferica. No estudo do desenvolvimento, verificou-se que todas as funcoes de acoplamento energetico na magnetopausa apresentaram um comportamento similar, isto e, a componente sul do CMI, no sistema referencial da magnetosfera, e quem essencialmente regula o acoplamento. A funcao do tipo campo eletrico Ey e a funcao do tipo potencia eletrica resultaram no melhor ajuste linear no acoplamento. No entanto, as complexidades nessas relacoes de acoplamento indicam a acao conjunta de outros processos de transferencia energetica, tais como transferencias nao proporcionais, interaáoes viscosas e processo de descarga abrupta da energia armazenada na cauda magnetosferica
   91:  FDB-19921510
   92:  FDB-MDF

    1:  SID/SCD

    7:               [07] 551.581.1(811.3)
   16:  Rocha, Humberto Ribeiro da
   18:  Modelagem da interacao biosfera-atmosfera para areas de floresta e pastagem na Amazonia
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  SPG
   59:  MET
   62:  INPE
   64:  mar. <1992>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  MICROMETEOROLOGIA
   87:  MODELOS ATMOSFêRICOS
   87:  MODELAGEM
   87:  PASTAGEM
   87:  INTERACAO
   87:  VEGETACAO
   87:  CIRCULAÄAO ATMOSFERICA
   87:  DESMATAMENTO
   87:  POLUIÄ«O AMBIENTAL
   82:  <AMAZONIA (REGIAO)>
   83:   Em continuidade aos recentes estudos de mudancas climaticas causadas pelo desmatamento na Amazonia, como a diminuicao da evaporacao local (Wright et al., 1992), e a reducao de 20
   83:   na precipitacao regional (Nobre et al.,1991), utiliza-se o modelo da biosfera SiB (Sellers et al.,1986) para a calibracao de seus parametros em regioes de pastagem na Amazonia e a analise da influencia da vegetacao de superficie na estrutura da camada limite e na formacao da atividade convectiva na coluna atmosferica. A interacao da vegetacao com a atmosfera e aqui estudada utilizando-se um modelo unidimensional de 18 camadas na vertical com parametrizacoes de superficie, difusao vertical turbulenta, radiacao de ondas curtas e longas, canveccao rasa e profunda e precipitacao de grande escala. E analisado o desempenho de um esquema de controle (Ctr1D), cuja superficie e baseada nas leis de similaridade de Monin e Obukhov (1954) e evaporacao segundo a equacao de Penman-Monteith, alem de um esquema de fechamento turbulento de 1 ordem na camada limite, em comparacao com um novo modelo acoplado neste trabalho (SiB1D), que tem o modelo SiB) na superficie e um esquema de fechamento turbulento de ordem 2.0 (Mellor e Yamada, 1982) na camada limite. O modelo SiB1D mostra-se realista em simular os fluxos de calor sensivel e latente a superficie para areas de floresta e pastagem na Amazonia. Alem disso, obten-se uma resolucao numerica que suprime oscilacoes originalmente encontradas no modelo Ctr1D. As simulacoes do SiB1D mostram que a atividade convectiva e mais intensa na coluna atmosferica sobre a floresta do que sobre a pastagem, com aumento de 25 a 50
   83:   na precipitacao. Isto levaria a um aquecimento de ate 2,5 K na media troposfera e ao umedecimento ate na ordem de 2,0g/Kg na camada limite maiores sobre a floresta
   91:  FDB-19920528
   92:  FDB-MLR

   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  ASTROFISICA
   83:   Utilizamos uma amostra atualizada de 134 aglomerados globulares com um erro em magnitude de 0,40 para testar um novo modelo de estimacao da distancia ao Centro Galactico. O modelo se baseia num diagnostico dos efeitos de selecao na distribuicao azimutal local dos aglomerados para redistribui-los sistematicamente em torno de candidatos ao suposto centro de simetria do sistema. O procedimento testa subamostras de extensao espacial variada e utiliza a media, a mediana e uma media ponderada por coeficientes bionomiais para estimar separadamente o deslocamento do centroide dos sistemas alterados. Para cada subamostra selecionamos o candidato com a menor modulacao de seu deslocamento medio conjunto com a dispersao associada, e concluimos a partir de uma analise de medias ponderadas que o resultado mais consistente favorece uma estimativa de Ro=6,90+0,33Kpc

   12:  Coupling parameterization in magnetosphere-ionosphere-thermosphere modeling
   14:  293-301
   30:  Advances in Space Research
   31:  12
   32:  6
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DAE
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1992>
   68:  PRE
   76:  AERONOMIA
   87:  conex∆o ionosfera
   87:  parametrizaá∆o
   87:  termosfera
   87:  regi∆o F2
   88:  magnetosphere
   88:  ionosphere coupling
   88:  parametrization
   88:  thermosphere
   88:  F2 region
   83:  A  review is provided of some of the major interactions in the magnetosphere-ionosphere-thermosphere system, with emphasis on those internal interactions involving mutual coupling between neutral winds, plasma drifts, and the F2-layer peak height. Examples of parameter-izations for interactions of this type at low, middle, and high latitudes, intended for use in numerical predictions, are presented. A new parameterization for hmF2 in terms of wind-and electric field-driven drifts at equatorial latitudes is given, and verifications of the accuracy of previously developed parameterizations at middle and high latitudes are provided

    1:  SID/SCD

   10:  Dutra, Severino Luiz Guimaraes
   10:  Pereira, A.E.C.
   10:  Gonzalez-Alarcon, Walter Demetrio
   10:  Gonzalez, Alicia Luisa Clua
   12:  DOWNWARD MAPPING OF QUASI-STATIC IONOSPHERIC ELECTRIC-FIELDS AT LOW LATITUDES DURING FAIR WEATHER
   14:  223-230
   30:  Journal of Geophysical Research,
   31:  54
   32:  3-4
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DGE
   59:  MAGNET
   61:  <PI>
   64:  Mar./Apr. <1992>
   68:  PRE
   76:  GEOFISICA ESPACIAL
   87:  CAMPO ELETRICO
   87:  IONOSFERA
   87:  SSQ CURRENT
   87:  MIDDLE
   83:  The problem of downward mapping of equatorial ionospheric electric fields is studied in two dimensions employing the finite elements and finite differences numerical techniques. The solutions obtained for low latitudes are compared with known results for high latitudes. It is found that equatorial ionospheric electric fields of scale lengths of the order of 100 km or more reach balloon heights (30-40 km) without undergoing noticeable attenuation. However, in the case of equatorial ionospheric electric fields of scale lengths of a few tens of kilometers it is found that these fields reach balloon heights with severe attenuation. The corresponding attenuation factors are significantly larger than those known for high latitudes. It is also shown that the presence of mountains with a fairly large height as well as of a large-scale conductivity irregularity in the middle atmosphere, such as that expected in the South Atlantic Magnetic Anomaly (SAMA) region during energetic electron precipitation events, can considerably distort the mapped ionospheric electric fields at the middle atmosphere
   91:  FDB - 19980826
   92:  FDB - EGCF

   12:  Thermospheric models: a short review
   14:  7-16
   30:  Revista Brasileira de Geofisica
   31:  8
   32:  1
   40:  En

   88:  THERMOSPHERE
   83:  In this short review, thermospheric models are briefly discussed concerning their completeness compared to the first order Navier-Stokes equations. It is concluded that empirical models are the most reliable reference for the dynamical equilibrium behaviour of the thermosphere. The three-dimensional time dependent models still need some work before they reach their final stage

   12:  On the rocket-induced wave disturbances in the daytime,equatorial ionosphere
   14:  2758-2760
   30:  Journal of Geophysical Research
   31:  93
   32:  A4
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   53:  Assembleia Geral da Ini∆o Internacional de Geodesia e Geof°sica (IUGG), 19
   54:  ago. <1997>
   56:  Vancauver
   58:  DAE
   59:  IONO
   61:  <PI>
   64:  Abr. <1988>
   68:  PRE
   76:  AERONOMIA
   87:  regi∆o F
   87:  medidas no local
   87:  densidade eletron ionosferica
   88:  F region
   88:  in situ measurements
   88:  ionospheric electron density
   83:  In situ measurements of daytime equatorial ionospheric E and F region electron densities were carried out using a high-frequency capacitance probe on board a SONDA III rocket launched from Natal, Brazil, on July 26,1984. Wave structures in the electron density profile having a scale length of -1.5 km to -10 km and amplitude of-10 percent of the ambient density were detected during the downleg trajectory. Possible sources of these waves are discussed, and their possible implication for irregularity formation under nighttime conditions is briefly mentioned

    1:  SID/SCD
    2:  4432
    3:  INPE-4432-PRE/1234
    4:  MET
    5:  S
    6:  as
    7:               [07] 556.123
   10:  Vadlamudi, Brahmananda Rao
   10:  Hada, Kioshi
   12:  Characteristics of rainfall over Brazil: annual variations and connections with the southern oscillation
   14:  81-91
   30:  Theoretical and Applied Climatology
   31:  42
   32:  2
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DCM
   59:  CLIMA
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDO DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   87:  CLIMATOLOGIA DINAMICA
   87:  CHUVA
   87:  VARIACAO ANUAL
   87:  ZONA DE CONVERGENCIA INTERTROPICAL
   87:  OSCILACAO
   83:   Annual and interannual variations of rainfall over Brazil are discussed. First, rainy and dry seasons for several stations of Brazil are determined using the data of 21 years(1958-1978). The progressive movement of the Intertropical Convergence Zone seems to be associated with the progresive variation of rainfall seasons in the equatorial eastern Brazil. The annual migration of deep tropical convection from Central and southern Portion of the Amazon basic in austral  summer to the northwestern sector of South America in austral winter seems to be responsible for the annual cycle of  rainfall in the Amazon basin. The conncection between the interannual variation of rainfall over Brazil and the Southern Oscillation is also discussed. The correlation coefficient between the Southern Oscillation index and the rainfall is generally small over most of Brazil except over Rio Grande do Sul. The correlation between the spring rainfall of Rio Grande do Sul and and the Southern Oscillation index of the same or of the previous season is significantly high and shows prospects for seasonal rainfall prediction

   92:  FDB-MD
  101:  D

   12:  Latitudinal gradient in the plasma bubble zonal velocities as observed by scanning 630-nm airglow measurements
   14:  8253-8257
   30:  Journal of Geophysical Research
   31:  95
   32:  A6
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DAE
   61:  <PI>
   64:  June <1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  AERONOMIA
   87:  BOLHAS DE PLASMA
   87:  IONOSFERA
   88:  ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION
   88:  PLASMA BUBBLES
   88:  AIRGLOW
   88:  ELECTRIC FIELDS
   88:  EQUATORIAL ATMOSPHERIC
   82:  <CACHOEIRA PAULISTA (SP)>
   83:  Equatorial ionospheric plasma bubble zonal velocities were measured using two 630-nm scanning photometers. Simultaneous scanning measurements were made in two east-west planes that were tilted 30 degrees northward and southward of the vertical. The results of measurements carried out during 5 days covering the summer equinoctial period of 1988, presented here, show evidence of marked latitudinal gradient in the bubble zonal velocities, the velocities decreasing with increasing latitude over low-latitude observing site, Cachoeira Paulista (-28 degrees dip). We suggest that this velocity gradient is consistent with expectations at solar minimum, when our measuremnts may be associated with the region above the maximum in the eastward plasma velocity height profile
   91:  FDB-19960311
   92:  FDB-MLR

   83:  A comparative study is carried out between a semi-empirical low-latitude ionospheric model (SLIM), including calculated 01630 nm airglow emission intensities predicted by the SLIM model, with ionospheric and 01 630 nm airglow measurements carried out at Cachoeira Paulista (22.71S, 45.01W; geomag. 11.9'S), Brazil. A long series of regular measurements of ionospheric F-region peak electron densities and peak heights, and regular zenith measurements of the 01630 nm airglow emission intensities, made during the period 1975-1982, are used for comparison with corresponding parameters predicted by the SLIM model. Large discrepancies between the observed and model-predicted 01 630 nm intensities have been found for high solar activity, mainly due to an overestimate of the F-region peak heights by the SLIM model. Use of SLIM profiles normalized by actual F-region peak height and density observations essentially removed the disagreements. The reasons for the height discrepancies are discussed in terms of the longitudinal dependence of the geomagnetic control on the ExB vertical plasma drifts and the thermospheric neutral wind effects on the F-region. The effects of the magnetic declination angle on both the E x B ionospheric plasma drifts and thermospheric neutral winds at low-latitude suggest that ionospheric models need to address separately the longitudinal zones of magnetic declination either positive, negative or zero


   91:  8809

   87:  BOLHAS DE PLASMA

   87:  SONDA
   88:  ELECTRON DENSITY PROFILES
   88:  INTERNACIONAL REFERENCE IONOSPHERE
   88:  IRI
   88:  SLIM
   88:  EQUATORIAL ATMOSPHERIC
   88:  ROCKETS
   82:  <NATAL (RN)>
   83:  Three experiments were conducted using high frequency capacitance probes carried on board SONDA III rockets launched off the coast of Natal (6 degrees S, 36 degrees W), Brasil. Electron-density height profiles from the two of the experiments, one daytime, and one nighttime, are representative of quiet equatorial ionospheric conditions whereas for the third experiment the rocket was launched into a nighttime ionosphere that was disturbed by a developing plasma bubble event. Agreement between experimental results and the IRI predictions for the quiet day and night densities varies with height. Comparisons are also made with electron densities obtained from the semi-empirical Low Latitude Ionospheric Model (SLIM)

    1:  SID/SCD

    6:  as

   10:  Clemesha, Barclay Robert
   12:  Stratification processes in the atmospheric sodium layer: observations and theory
   14:  (10)59-(10)70
   30:  Advances in Space Research
   31:  10
   32:  10
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   53:  COSPAR-ESPOO, 27
   54:  18-29 July <1988>
   56:  Helsinkei
   57:  FI
   58:  DAE
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  AERONOMIA
   88:  ATMOSPHERIC LASERS
   88:  ATMOSPHERIC TIDES
   88:  SODIUM LAYER
   83:  The mechanisms responsible for the formation of the alkali metal layers seem to be quite different in nature to those responsible for other atmospheric layers. In discussing the sodium layer in this context we must include both the mechanisms responsible for its basic production and the phenomena which produce structures within the layer. Although there is little doubt that the sodium layer owes its origin to the deposition into the atmosphere of extra-terrestrial material, how this deposition leads to the formation of a narrow layer of free sodium atoms is still an open question. With respect to the formation of structures within the layer it is clear that tides and gravity waves play an important role, although there can be little doubt that other factors are also at work. Of particular interest is the observation of thin layers having peak densities about an order of magnitude greater than normal, and a width an order of magnitude less. A number of mechanisms for the formation of these layers have been discussed in the literature, including direct meteor deposition, ion layer formation via the windshear mechanism, and evaporation from aerosol layers. None of these mechanisms has been analysed in detail, however, and the origin of these layers is still open to debate
   91:  19960311
   92:  FDB-MLR

   82:  <NATAL (ESTADO)>
   83:  A SONDA III rocket was launched from Natal on 11 December 1985, at 2030 LT, carrying a Langmuir probe that measured the kinetic electron temperature in the E and F regions of the equatorial ionosphere over Natal, Brazil. The rocket attained an altitude of 524 km. The electron temperature was determined through the derivative of the current versus voltage characteristics of the Langmuir probe and the detection of the floating potential. Results are compared with the IRI model, and the divergence of the results with the model is discussed

   12:  Variability of the Sq focus position in the South American Continent
   14:  405-412
   30:  Proceedings of the Indian Academy of Sciences (Earh and Planetary Sciences
   31:  99
   32:  3
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DGE

   76:  GEOFISICA ESPACIAL
   83:  The daily variation of the H component at Pilar (31.7 degrees S, 63.9 degrees W) and Trelew (43.3 degrees S, 65.3 degrees W) in the South American continent indicates a great variability in amplitude from season to season and even from day to day. However, Pilar always remains equatorward of the southern Sq focus. On the other hand, Trelew is in most cases slightly poleward of the Sq focus but the focus has large latitudinal excursions above and near Trelew. A cause of this variability could be the encroachment of polar ionospheric current systems into the low latitude ionospheric Sq current system

   12:  LATITUDINAL GRADIENT IN THE PLASMA BUBBLE ZONAL VELOCITIES AS OBSERVED BY SCANNING 630 NM AIRGLOW MEASUREMENTS
   14:  8253-8257
   30:  Journal of Geophysical Research
   31:  95
   32:  A6
   42:  <E>
   58:  DAE
   59:  IONAP
   61:  <PI>
   64:  June <1990>
   68:  PRE
   75:  AERONOMIA
   83:  Equatorial ionospheric plasma bubble zonal velocities were measured using two 630-nm scanning photometers. Simultaneous scanning measurements were made in two east-west planes that were tilted 30ß northward and southward of the vertical. The results of measurements carried out during 5 days covering the summer equinoctial period of 1988, presented here, show evidence of marked latitudinal gradient in the bubble zonal velocities, the velocities decreasing with increasing latitude over our low-latitude observing site, Cachoeira Paulista (-28ß dip). We suggest that this velocity gradient is consistent with expectations at solar minimum, when our measurements may be associated with the region above the maximum in the eastward plasma velocity height profile

   12:  Magnetic activity effects on range type spread-F and vertical plasma drifts at Fortaleza and Huancayo as studied through ionosonde measurements and theoretical modelling
   14:  357-364
   30:  Annales Geophysicae
   31:  8
   32:  5
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   53:  Latin American Conference on Space Geophysics, 1
   54:  21-25 Nov. <1988>
   56:  µguas de Lindoias
   57:  BR
   58:  DAE
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  AERONOMIA
   87:  IONOSSONDA
   87:  mediá∆o
   88:  IONOSONDS
   88:  MEASUREMENT
   88:  SPREAD F
   82:  <FORTALEZA (CE)><HUANCAYO>
   83:  Ionosonde measurements are used to study the effects of magnetic activity on spread F and on the postsunset enhancement (Vzmax) of the F region vertical plasma drift at two longitudinally separated stations, Fortaleza and Huancayo, situated along the magnetic equator, in the American sector, during a period of high solar activity. The analysis is made for three different levels of magnetic activity. It is seen that, during the winter, Vzmax and the range spread F occurrence (RSFO) in the premidnight hours systematically increase with Kp at both locations. During the summer and equinoxes the RSFO decreases with magnetic activity in the premidnight hours and increases in the postmidnight hours, the increase being generally more pronounced during very disturbed periods. On the other hand Vzmax deduced from the ionosonde measurements shows almost no variation with magnetic activity during equinoxes and summer although during individual months of those periods both increases and decreases are seen. With the help of theoretical model calculations for the electrodynamical coupling between the equatorial E and F regions it is shown that a disturbance F region dynamo associated neutral wind could account for the variations of Vzmax with magnetic activity, that are consistently observed during winter months. On the other hand, competing influences of penetration electric fields, and/or those of disturbance meridional winds, seem to mask the expected gross effect of zonal winds in the summer and equinoctial months

   12:  The cluster of galaxies SC2008-57 (A3667)
   14:  233-246
   30:  Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society
   31:  259
   32:  2
   38:  En
   40:  En
   41:  <E>
   58:  DAS
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1992>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  ASTROFISICA
   88:  GALACTIC CLUSTERS
   88:  LUMINOSITY
   83:  We present the results of photometric and spectroscopic observations of the cluster of galaxies SC2008-57 (A3667). The observations have resulted in a catalogue with positions and magnitudes for 203 galaxies, complete at b25=18.0 and radial velocities for 128 galaxies, 91 per cent complete at b25=17.5. The cluster can be classified as type L because its balaxy distribution is highly flattened. It shows two strong concentrations: a main concentration, centred on the cluster brightest galaxy (a D galaxy) and coincident with the peak of X-ray emission, and a substructure around the second brightest galaxy (also a D galaxy). Most of the galaxies in this substructure seem to be found to the second-brightest galaxy, forming a dynamical subunit inside the cluster. The extreme flattening of the cluster may at least partially be due to the presence of the substructure. The cluster also shows evidence for luminosity segregation, with the brightest galaxies being preferentially found in high galaxy density regions. Most of the luminosity segregation, however, is produced by galaxies associated with the two clumps around the D galaxies, suggesting that dynamical friction is effective in subclusters with low velocity dispersions and may be associated with the formation of D galaxies. The velocity dispersion of SC2008-57 is high, about 1200 km s-1, but consistent with the observed X-ray luminosity. The cluster mass, derived using several estimators, is about 2.6 x 10 15 M . Both the cluster mass and velocity dispersion may be overestimates due to the presence of the substructure

   10:  Sawant, Hanumant Shankar
   10:  Lattari, C.J.B.
   10:  Benz, A.O.
   10:  Dennis, B.R
   12:  Hard X-rays associated weak decimetric bursts
   14:  57-73
   30:  Solar Physics
   31:  130
   32:  1-2
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DAS
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  ASTROFISICA
   83:  In previous attempts to show one-to-one correlation between type III bursts and X-ray spikes, there have been ambiguities as to which of several X-rays spikes are correlated with any given type III burst. Here, we present observations that show clear associations of X-ray bursts with RS type III bursts between 16:46 UT and 16:52 UT on July 9, 1985. The hard X-ray observations were made at energies above 25 keV with HXRBS on SMM and the radio observations were made at 1.63 GHz using the 13.7 m Itapetinga antenna in R and L polarization with a time resolution of 3 ms. Detailed comparison between the hard X-ray and radio observations shows: (1) In at least 13 cases we can identify the associated hard X-ray and decimetric RS bursts. (2) On average, the X-ray peaks were delayed from the peak of the RS bursts at 1.6 GHz by 400 ms although a delay as long as 1 s was observed in one case. One possible explanation of the long delays between the RS bursts and the associated X-ray is that RS bursts is produced at the leading edge of the electron beam, whereas the X-ray burst peaks at the time of arrival of the bulk of the electrons at the high density region at the lower corona and upper chromosphere. Thus, the time comparison must be made between the peak of the radio pulse and the start of the X-ray burst. In that case the delays are consistent with an electron travel time with velocity 0.3 c from the 800 MHz plasma level to the lower corona assuming that the radio emission is at the second harmonic
   91:  FDB-1990322
   92:  FDB-MLR

   12:  Time delays between decimetric type III-RD bursts and associated hard x-rays

   83:  In July, 1985 radio observations were made at 1.6 GHz using 13.7 m Itapetinga antenna with time resolution of 3 ms. The hard X-ray observations were obtained from HXRBS on SMM. Comparison of 1.6 GHz observations with dynamic spectra in the frequency range of (1000 - 100) MHz and hard X-rays shows the following results: i) In 12 cases we identify continuation of type III-RD bursts up to 1.6 GHz suggesting presence of type III-RD at 1.6 GHz. ii) For the first time, we have identified hard X-ray peaks delayed in comparison to decimetric type III-RD bursts. These delays are longer - 1 s - than expected (100 ms) and have been interpreted assuming that the decimetric emission is at 2 nd harmonic and caused by the leading edge of the exciter, whereas peaks of X-rays have been attributed to entire entry of the exciter into the X-ray producing region

   83:  There is a lack of mm-wavelenght spectroscopic solar observations.    12:  Homologous and homologous like microwave solar radio burst
   14:  557-561
   30:  Revista Mexicana de Astronomia y Astrofisica
   31:  21
   32:  Numero especial
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DAS
   61:  <PI>
   64:  Nov.<1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  ASTROFISICA
   83:  Solar radio observations at 1.6 GHz were carried out in the month of July, 1985 by using 13.7 m diameter Itapetinga antenna with time resolution of 3 ms. Homologous Bursts, with total duration of about couple of seconds and repeated by some seconds were observed associated with Homologous H-  flares. These H-  flares were having periodicities of about 40 min. Observed long periodocities were attributed to oscillation of prominences, and small periods were attributed to removal of plasma from the field interaction zone. Also observed are "Homologous-Like" bursts. These bursts are double peak bursts with same time profile repeating in time. In addition to this, the ratio of the total duration of the burts to time difference in the peaks of bursts remain constant. Morphological studies of these bursts have been presented
   91:  FDB-19960325

   18:  Controle de um sistema de manutencao quando os tempos de Falha e reparo tem distribuicao do tipo fase
   20:  126
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  E
   50:  Instituto de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  UPG/CPT
   59:  ANS
   62:  INPE
   64:  set. <1990>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  METEOROLOGIA
   83:   No modelo de reparo de maquinas considerado neste trabalho tem-se M+R maquinas identicas, M em operacao e R de reserva. Todas as maquinas sao independentes uma das outras. Quando uma maquina em operacao falha, ela e enviada a estacao de reparo composta de um unico servidor imediatamente substituida por uma maquina de reserva, se disponivel. O servidor tem dois tipos de reparo disponiveis para usar na maquina que falhou. Existem custos de espera das maquinas na fila de reparo, custos de reparo, custos de perda de producao e custos de troca do tipo de reparo. Este trabalho trata do seguinte problema de decisao: obter uma politica estacionaria que determine o tipo de reparo a ser utilizado, em funcao do estado do sistema, de maneira a minimizar o custo medio esperado a longo prazo quando os tempos de falha e reparo tem distribuicao de Cox de ordem 2. Este problema de controle e representado por um modelo de decisao semi-markoviano. O Algoritmo de Iteracao de Politicas e o Algoritmo de Iteracao de Valores sao usados para obtencao da politica otima. Apresentam-se resultados numericos para estes dois metodos de otimizacao
   91:  FDB-19920915

   12:  Power spectrum analysis of the time-series of annual mean surface air temperatures
   14:  121-130
   30:  Climatic Change
   31:  17
   32:  1
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DGE
   61:  <PI>
   64:  Aug. <1990>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  GEOFISICA ESPACIAL
   83:  Maximum Entropy Spectral Analysis of the annual mean surface temperature series for land masses and sea in the northern and southern hemispheres indicated long-term linear warming trends of (0.12 to 0.56)  C/century with superposed significant periods in the ranges T=5-6 yr, 10-11 yr, 15 yr, 20 yr, 28-32 yr, and 55-80 yr. Extrapolation in future indicated for 2000-2030 a departure of (+0.4 degree C) above the 1950-70 level. However, for the 1980s, the observed values are above the expected level, probably indicating large greenhouse effects due to human intervention. In that case, our predictions would be underestimates

   12:  Power spectrum analysis of the annual rainfall series for Massachusetts (NE, USA)
   14:  89-94
   30:  Climatic Change
   31:  18
   32:  1
   40:  EN
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DGE
   58:  DAS
   61:  <PI>
   64:  Jan. <1991>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  GEOFISICA ESPACIAL
   83:  Maximum Entropy Spectral Analysis of the annual rainfall series for 1887-1976 (90 years) for Massachusets (northeastern U.S.A.) shows T= 17.8 (very near the 18.6 year luni-solar signal) as the most prominent periodicity. However, it explains only 12
   83:   variance. Also, the next prominent periodicity is T=2.72 years, i.e. in the QBO (Quasi-Biennial Oscillation, T=2-3 years) region. Also, regular periodicities account for only 50
   83:   variance, leaving 50
   83:   as a random component. Hence, predictions are unreliable. Roughly, excess rainfall during 1990-1994 and droughts during 1992-2002 are indicated; but occasional years of opposite behavior cannot be ruled out

   12:  X-ray and infrared selected AGN - II. Optical spectroscopy
   14:  1722-1739
   30:  Astronomical Journal,
   31:  99
   32:  6
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DAS
   59:  EXTRA
   61:  <PI>
   64:  June <1990>
   68:  PRE
   76:  ASTROFISICA
   83:  In a search for obscured active galactic nuclei we selected 144 x-ray/infrared emitting galaxies. Optical spectroscopy of this sample is presented. A classification according to the nuclear activity shows that 28 are AGN, 39 are transition-type objects and 44 are H ii region-like galaxies. Three of the 28 AGN are Seyfert 1 galaxies and the others are of Type 2. We suggest that the objects identified as narrow line AGN are obscured Seyfert 1. Most of the observed galaxies are seen edge-on, indicating that dust may have a flattened distribution coplanar to the disk of the parent galaxy. With the inclusion of the newly identified AGN, the sample of the x-ray emitting Seyfert 2 galaxies is fairly complete above a flux limit of log FHX  - 10. 8

   12:  Sistema de Estacoes Meteorologicas Regionais para previsao de tempo
   14:  6
   20:  471-475
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   42:  <E>
   53:  Simposio Brasileiro de Sensoriamento Remoto, 6

   59:  BWIPS

   62:  INPE
   64:  jul. <1990>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   83:   Na complexidade da vida social atual, com suas atividades industriais, agricolas, transportes e ate turisticas, os fenomenos atmosferico podem adquirir muita importancia sobretudo em situacoes dramaticas. O trabalho de previsao meteorologica que ja se desenvolve no Brasil com uma certa tradicao comeca a exigir uma modernizacao e uma estruturacao de seus servicos de forma que seja capaz de enfrentar requisitos ainda mais rigorosos, para aumentar sua produtividade, eficiencia e confiabilidade. Estas caracteristicas devem estar presentes tanto no sistema de previsao para longo prazo como na previsao local e imediata (nowcasting). Assim sendo, so o emprego de alta tecnologia em sensoriamento, computacao e processamento grafico interativo, podera suprir necessidade operacionais, que entre outras, sao marcadas pela exigencia de um monitoramento em tempo real, em tres dimensoes, numa escala regional. O objetivo maior e conduzir a normalizacao dos servicos dentro de padroes modernos, provendo detecoes mais confiaveis de fenomenos severos, podendo consequentemente produzir ALERTAS DE TEMPO. As informacoes fornecidas devem dar suporte desde a protecao de vidas ate a decisoes relacionadas a produtividade economica. Este esforco, porem exige o tracado de um plano estrategio de desenvolvimento e de implantacao que bem se adapte ao Brasil. O projeto proposto de uma rede moderna e estruturada de sistemas regionais para a previsao de tempo de curto prazo, abrangente em dados, e que integre interativamente seus produtos com grande versatilidade, de certo proporcionara servicos que combinarao produtividade com eficiencia
   91:  9006

   83:  Changes of the H component observed by MAGSAT for equatorial dawn and dusk passes at seven altitude slabs equivalent to 30 km each, viz. 340-370, 400-430, 430-460, 460-490, 490-520 and 520-540 km were compared with ground Dst. The correlation coefficients were generally high (>+0.90) except for some slabs in some longitude belts, when correlations were lower, indicating these slabs as possible sources of some stray, transient currents. However, deltaHo, i.e. the intercepts on the deltaHo axis, were always negative for all slabs, indicating that, if a steady current existed, it should be above the ground, but below 340 km altitude

   83:   Este sistema implementa a automacao das fases de integracao e teste no ciclo de desenvolvimento de um satelite. Atuando entre o engenheiro de teste e os subsistemas do satelite de Coleta de Dados (SCDC) da Missao Espacial Completa Brasileira (MECB), processa o fluxo de dados e os comandos durante as fases mencionadas. As informacoes adquiridas sao tratadas e expostas em telas graficas para facil interpretacao em tempo real. As caracteristicas principais abrangem o "check" automatico, a programacao interativa e a sintetizacao-apresentacao grafica do estado dos subsistemas em teste. A modularidade foi um conceito importante no projeto do sistema, que e constituido pelos Modulos de Aquisicao, Monitoracao e Visualizacao. Adicionalmente, este sistema apresenta uma flexibilidade de reconfiguracao conforme requisito. O sistema foi projetado e implementado no INPE dentro do contexto da Missao Espacial Completa Brasileira (MECB) em conjunto com o Laboratorio de Integracao e Teste (LIT)

   12:  Profiles of emission lines in active galactic nuclei - III. Observations of H alfa, Nii and Sii profiles
   14:  470-483
   30:  Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society
   31:  245
   32:  3
   38:  En
   40:  En
   41:  <E>
   58:  DAS
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1990>
   68:  PRE
   76:  ASTROFISICA
   83:  High-resolution (FWHM=28 km s-1) observations of Halfa [N ii]lambda6548/6583 and [S ii]lambda6717/6731 emission lines in several southern active galactic nuclei (AGN) are presented. Deblending of the Halfa+[N ii] profiles was performed using, when available, the [O iii]lambda5007 profile shape as a template. Line profile measurements, as well as line intensities, are tabulated. We found to be relatively common among the observed objects the existence of structure in the line cores, pointing to the complexity of dynamics in the low-velocity emission region. Differences in profile shape and width amongst different lines are also common, indicating that often there is a superposition, on the spectrograph slit, of emission regions with different dynamics and excitation conditions. This superposition is quantified  in the case of IC 5063. We found weak, broad H alfa emission in IC 5063 and IC 5135. In NGC 2992, we were unable to confirm the presence of a broad H alfa component with the same intensity as found by previous authors, which we ascribe to spectral resolution effects
   91:  FDB-19960322
   92:  FDB-MLR

   12:  Gamma-ray observations of SN1987A
   14:  459-462
   30:  Revista Mexicana de Astronomia y Astrofisica
   31:  21
   32:  Numero Especial
   40:  En

   88:  STARS
   88:  GAMMA-RAYS
   88:  SUPERNOVA 1987A
   83:  We present gamma-ray observations of SN1987A in the energy range from 150 keV to 1 MeV carried out on June 19, 1988, on-board a stratospheric balloon with two NaI(T1) detectors (600 cm2 total area). The telescope incorporated a passive collimator and was mounted on a stabilized platform which allowed observations with a pointing accuracy of approximately 2 degrees in azimuth. The flight altitude was about 5.5 mb and the total observation time was 6 hours, divided between source and background. The 2 sigma upper limits for the continuum are 2.45x10-5 and 5.42x 10-6 photons cm-2 s-1 keV-1 in the 0.15 to 0.30 MeV and 0.30 to 1.00 MeV energy bands, respectively
   91:  FDB-19960325

   16:  Oliveira, Carlos Alberto
   18:  Ideal, uma Interface Dialogica em Linguagem natural para Sistemas Especialistas
   20:  260
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  E 
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Doutor
   58:  SPG
   58:  LAC
   59:  CAP
   64:  out. <1990>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  COMPUTACAO
   83:   No tratamento automatico de Linguagem Natural (LN), conjugar o que o usuario pode e deve saber (conhecimento do mundo) com o que a interface sabe (regras) e faz (interferencias), integrando-se os niveis de analise linguistica, e o principio de onde parte o Sistema IDEAL. Este sistema e uma ferramenta para a construcao de interfaces em LN para sistemas especialistas. A partir de um conhecimento lexicosemantico-pragmatico vazio, o IDEAL constroi, na interacao dinamica com o usuario, um universo linguistico suficiente para a tarefa de compreender, interpretar e traduzir frases em LN para dada representacao de conhecimento num dominio particular de aplicacao. Sob a otica de processos integrados de analise, interpretacao e traducao, a medida que as frases forem sendo respondidas, o IDEAL incorporara as relacoes abstraidas das respostas, aumentando o poder de interpretacao da interface. Serao constantemente reavaliados pesos determinados preliminares, os quais funcionarao como "guias" de analise e interpretacao, construindo-se um subconjunto lexical e de regras vigentes para dados tipos de usuario e para dado dominio de conhecimento
   91:  9009

   83:   Propoe-se, neste trabalho, as bases para elaboracao de um gerador automatico de (pre) indices e de (pre) resumos, a partir de uma abordagem linguistico-pragmatica. Sucintamente, o criterio utilizado para a discriminacao das "palavras" e/ou expressoes que comporao indices e resumos sera o do numero maior de ocorrencias dessas no texto-fonte, aliado a uma heuristica relacionada ao nivel de profundidade da ocorrencia dentro de uma representacao de conhecimentos linguistica. Para tanto, utilizar-se um prototipo de processamento de linguagem natural ja desenvolvido e baseado em conhecimento linguistico textual

    6:  as
    7:               [07] 
   10:  Kane, Rajaram Purushottam
   10:  Trivedi, Nalin Babulal
   12:  Spectral analysis of annual sunspot series: an update
   14:  463-474
   30:  Pure and Applied Geophysics,
   31:  135
   32:  3
   40:  En
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   58:  DGE
   58:  DAE
   61:  <PI>
   64:  <1991>
   68:  PRE
   90:  b
   76:  GEOFISICA ESPACIAL
   83:  Maximum Entropy Spectral Analysis (MESA) of annual spots series for 1700-1987 (288 points) indicated the most prominent peak at T=10.91 years, followed by T=10.62, 10.00 and 103 years of comparable amplitudes and twelve others of smaller amplitudes, all significant at a 3sigma a priori level. MacDonald (1989) has suggested that the method of spectral analysis should depend upon the choice of the chosen model. However, our results compare well with his results from a periodogram study, indicating that the choice of the model, generally difficult in geophysical problems, is not vital. Since amplitude estimates in MESA are unreliable, our prescription is to use MESA only for detecting possible periodicities and then, estimate amplitudes and phases by a separate Multiple Regression Analysis
   91:  9012

   20:  113

   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDOS DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   87:  METEOROLOGIA SINOTICA
   87:  PRECIPITACAO (METEOROLOGIA)
   87:  FRENTES
   82:  <RIO GRANDE DO SUL (ESTADO)>
   83:  Neste trabalho e feita uma tentativa para se obter previsao quantitativa de precipitacao associada a passagem de frentes sobre o Rio Grande do Sul (RS). Com este proposito sao construidos modelos de regressao linear multipla, expressando a precipitacao em termos de paramentros meteorologicos relacionados as frentes tais como, contraste termico, contraste de umidade e vorticidade ciclonica. Foram examinadas as cartas sinoticas e de ar supeior do periodo de tres anos, 1986-1988, para se identificar os Sistemas frontais que passam sobre o RS e para coletar os dados meteorologicos associados a tais episodios. A media da precipitacao acumulada de 24 horas entre 18 estacoes espalhadas sobre o RS e a variavel dependente e os parametros meterologicos atras da frente (Buenos Aires) e adiante da frente (Rio de Janeiro) e as combinacoes entre elas sao variaveis independentes. Ha quatro conjunto de dados para cada estacao do ano

   83:  Sondagens Audiomagnetoteluricas foram efetuadas em duas areas proximas das Minas de Camaqua (RS) com dois objetivos distintos: na area de Rodeio Velho procurou-se obter evidencias corroborativas as interpretacoes geologicas a partir de dados geomagneticos e gravimetricos anteriores; na regiao de Santa Maria, sondagens comparativas seriam realizadas entre areas mineralizadas e nao-mineralizadas em sulfetos. Em Rodeio Velho, as sondagens confirmam a presenca de centenas de metros de sedimentos, provavelmente afetados por estruturas verticais e alternancia de camadas resistiva e condutora. Na regiao de Santa Maria, as sondagens nas areas mineralizadas apresentaram uma camada intermediaria mais condutora, que aproximadamente coincide com a posicao da camada mineralizada

   18:  Analise de disturbios ondulatorios de leste sobre o Oceano Atlantico equatorial sul
   20:  134
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  <E>
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  SPG
   59:  MET
   62:  INPE
   64:  ago. <1990>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDOS DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   87:  ESTUDO DE LESTE
   87:  DISTURBIOS EQUATORIAIS
   82:  <OCEANO ATLANTICO EQUATORIAL SUL>
   83:  Analisa-se as caracteristicas ondulatorias basicas dos disturbios equatoriais de leste sobre o Oceano Atlantico Equatorial Sul, proximo a costa da America do Sul, durante o First GARP (Global Atmospheric Research Program) Global Experiment (FGGE). Foram utilizados dados do National Meteorological Center (NMC) e dados de radiacao de onda longa (ROL). Analises de diagramas tipo "Hovmoller" da componente meridional do vento revelam disturbios ondulatorios se propagando para oeste com velocidade de fase entre 10 a 12 m/s, periodo entre 5 a 6 dias, e comprimento de onda de 4800 km a 6200 km. Ha sinais de disturbios durante todo o ano. No outono ocorrem as ondas mais curtas, enquanto no inverno ocorrem as ondas mais longas. As analises mostram disturbios em ROL com periodos entre 10 a 30 e entre 30 a 60 dias. Os espectros de potencia da componente meridional do vento apresentam picos no intervalo de 3 a 5 dias em 5 S. Estes picos se destacam mais na estacoes de outono e inverno, em torno de 20 W e 25 W. Os espectros cruzados indicam ondas se propagando para oeste com a velocidade de 9m5 m/s e comprimento de onda de 3300 km durante o trimetre MAM, e velocidade de 15 m/s e comprimento de 5200 km durante o trimestre JJA

   90:  b
   76:  METEOROLOGIA
   83:   Dans ce documet sont rassembles sous forme de champs mensuels, une partie d'une etude entreprise au Center ORSTOM de Brest par Claudio Solano Pereira entre debut mars et fin aout 1990. Ce chercheur en oceanographie physique est de nationalite bresilienne; il est fonctionnaire de l'Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE) de Sao Jose dos Campos Sao Paulo, Bresil. Il occupa durant cette periode de 6 mois un poste de d'accueil de courte duree au sein de l'ORSTOM. Le travail presente ici s'integre dans le cadre du programme OPERA qui est une action de TOCA_France soutenue par le PNEDC. Il fut originellement propose au Departement T.O.A. de l'ORSTOM par Jacques Servain (ORSTOM/Brest). Ce dernier, ainsi que Alain Morliere (ORSTOM/Brest) collaborerent a sa realisation. Cette etude est un exemple de la cooperation internationale entre l'ORSTOM (France) et l'INPE (Bresil) dans le cadre du programme TOGA

   18:  Realizacao Experimental e estudos teoricos de absorvedores de radio frequencia
   20:  43
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  E
   58:  OBT/PNA
   62:  INPE
   64:  maio <1991>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  RPQ
   90:  b
   83:   Um modelo matematico que expressa a equivalencia com uma sucessao de linhas de transmissao com perdas foi elaborada e aplicado, por meio de calculo numerico, ao estudo de absorvedores de radiofrequencia de formato piramidal, confeccionados em espuma de poliuretano impregnada de negro de fumo finamente pulverizado. O modelo foi usado para verificar o desempenho esperado de pecas com diferentes valores de condutividade em microondas. Os resultados mostraram-se concordantes com as medidas de refletividade obtidas anteriormente, pelo metodo de arco, durante a fase de relizacao experimental dos absorvedores, quando a concentracao de negro de fumo foi sendo variada em busca de maiores atenuacoes do eco

   16:  Ferreira, Nivaldo Silveira
   18:  Simulacoes numericas de frontogenesis
   20:  97
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  E
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  SPG
   58:  CPTC
   59:  MET
   62:  INPE
   64:  abr. <1991>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDOS DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   83:   Neste trabalho foram realizados experimentos numericos de frontogenese utilizando um modelo numerico multinivel de area limitada. Como forcante frontogenetica foi utilizada a deformacao horizontal do escoamento. Foram realizadas simulacoes numericas para uma atmosfera seca e com os efeitos de parametrizacao do calor latente de condensacao. Os dois experimentos geraram frontogenese nos niveis inferiores e, tambem um jato paralelo a frente nos niveis superiores a esquerda da posicao da frontogeneses na superficie. A inclusao da parametrizacao do calor latente gerou uma frontogenese mais intensa, o movimento vertical tornou-se mais forte intensificando a convergencia na regiao frontogenetica. Houve uma intensificacao do jato nos altos niveis, sem no entanto mudar sua posicao em relacao ao experimento seco

MFN: 3023 

   18:  A instabilidade simetrica condicional e a formacao de bandas de precipitacao sobre o Estado de Sao Paulo
   20:  158
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  E
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  SPG
   59:  MET
   62:  INPE
   64:  fev. <1991>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  CIENCIAS METEOROLOGICAS
   87:  METEOROLOGIA DINAMICA
   82:  <SAO PAULO (ESTADO)>
   83:   Este estudo trata da Instabilidade Simetrica Condicional, das condicoes necessarias para sua deteccao, dos metodos para sua avaliacao e da possivel relacao com casos de banda de precipitacao sobre o Estado de Sao Paulo. As analises sao feitas atraves de radiossondagens e de mapas de radar meteorologico. Os resultados indicam que a organizacao de faixas de precipitacao de moderada a intensa, entre 30 e 70 Km de largura, conhecidas como bandas amplas, pode estar associada a presenca de uma camada rasa (entre a troposfera media e superior) com instabilidade potencial provavelmente resultante de Instabilidade Simetrica Condicional. O ar subjacente e geralmente condicionalmente estavel ou quase neutro. O metodo mais simples para a determinacao da Instabilidade Simetrica Condicional e obtido quantificando a "Slantwise Convective Available Potencial Energy" - SCAPE, atraves de uma radiossondagem. Verifica-se que ha SCAPE - 0 em 85 
   83:   dos casos observados de precipitacao em forma de banda

    7:               [07] 555.513
   16:  Rivero, Silvio Nilo Figueroa
   18:  Simulacoes da circulacao atmosferica no verao sobre a America do Sul com a presenca da Cordilheira dos Andes usando coordenadas Eta
   20:  110
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  E
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  MET
   62:  INPE
   64:  dez. <1991>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDOS DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   87:  METEOROLOGIA DINAMICA
   87:  ETA
   87:  CIRCULACAO ATMOSFERICA
   87:  FORCANTES TERMICAS
   82:  <CORDILHEIRA DOS ANDES>
   83:   Neste trabalho desenvolveu-se um modelo nao-linear multinivel de equacoes primitivas em coordenadas verticais eta (n). Este modelo e usado para estudar a influencia da Cordilheira dos Andes na circulacao atmosferica de verao sobre a America do Sul gerado pela forcante termica tropical localizada no Brasil Central e Sul da America. Incluindo ou excluindo os Andes o modelo reproduz muito bem as principais caracteristicas da circulacao de verao em alta troposfera, tais como a formacao da Alta de Bolivia e o Cavado sobre o Nordeste do Brasil. Em Baixos niveis encontrou-se que os Andes favorece a formacao de uma faixa de convergencia de orientacao NW-SE, na posicao climatologica da Zona de Convergencia do Atlantico Sul (ZCAS), o que sugere a hipotese que a conveccao sobre o Brasil Central e na Amazonia deve ser um dos fatores principais para a formacao da ZCAS e a presenca dos Andes seria um dos fatores que controlam seu posicionamento climatologico. Na presenca dos Andes tambem o modelo reproduz a formacao da "Baixa do Chaco" aproximadamente em sua posicao climatologica. Finalmente os resultados do modelo sugerem a existencia de uma forte interacao entre o escoamento do oeste em altos niveis sobre o Oceano Pacifico e a circulacao da Alta da Bolivia gerada pela fonte termica, principalmente na sua borda sul. Este ultimo resultado pode ter implicacoes sobre o deslocamento dos cavalos associados as frentes frias sobre a America do Sul
   91:  FDB-19920918
   92:  FDB-MD
  101:  D
  109:  04
  110:  1
  110:  1
  110:  1
  110:  1

  111:  Arquivo

MFN: 3026 

   18:  Efeitos Inter-Hemisfericos de intensas fontes tropicais de calor
   20:  152
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  E
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  SPG
   58:  CPTC
   59:  MET
   62:  INPE
   64:  maio <1991>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  ESTUDOS DO TEMPO E DO CLIMA
   87:  METEOROLOGIA DINAMICA
   82:  <AMERICA DO SUL>
   82:  <OCEANO ATLANTICO TROPICAL NORTE>
   83:   A resposta sobre a America do Sul a uma intensa perturbacao que se move sobre o Oceano Atlantico Tropical Norte (com liberacao de calor latente comparavel aquela associada a furacoes) e investigada usando um modelo nao-linear semilagrangino de equacoes primitivas de duas camadas. Os resultados do modelo  evidenciam um possivel acoplamento com sistemas frontais oriundos do Hemisferio Sul e a explosao convectiva que ocorre no Brasil central e oeste da Amazonia. A medida que o disturbio move-se para noroeste ao longo do Oceano Atlantico Tropical Norte, os ventos de altos (baixos) niveis de orientacao norte/nordeste (sul/sudeste) tornam-se mais intensos na costa norte do Brasil, em oposicao a circulacao tipicamente observada nesta regiao no periodo de agosto a outubro. Paralelamente a esta inversao da circulacao, aparece um centro de baixa pressao bem definido nas regioes central, norte e nordeste do Brasil. Os resultados tambem evidenciam a importancia dos termos nao-lineares na dinamica da evolucao do fenomeno: o cisalhamento vertical intenso inibe a resposta local e inter-hemisferica, assim como ocorre no caso em que o furacao esta imerso em um estado basico com intensa vorticidade anticiclonica. Estes efeitos nao-lineares podem ser relacionados ao termo da divergencia e da adveccao vertical na equacao da vorticidade
   91:  FDB-19920918

   16:  Souza, Paulo Fernando de
   18:  Variabilidade espacial e temporal das componentes atmosfericas do ciclo hidrologico da Amazonia durante o Experimento Meteorologico GTE/ABLE-2B
   20:  108
   40:  Pt
   41:  Pt
   41:  En
   42:  E
   50:  Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
   51:  Mestre
   58:  SPG
   59:  MET
   62:  INPE
   64:  abr. <1991>
   66:  Sao Jose dos Campos
   67:  BR
   68:  TDI
   90:  b
   76:  METEOROLOGIA
   87:  HIDROLOGIA
   83:   Este trabalho analisa a variabilidade espacial e temporal das componentes atmosfericas do ciclo hidrologico da regiao Amazonia durante o segundo experimento meteorologico Amazon Boundary Layer Experiment (ABLE-2B), realizado entre 13 de abril a 13 de maio de 1987. Foram utilizados dados de radiossondas nos horarios sinoticos obtido por seis estacoes da regiao (Belem, Manaus, Boa Vista, Tabatinga, Vilhena e Alta Floresta). Utilizou-se tambem dados de precipitacao coletados em varios locais da bacia amazonica. A analise da agua precipitavel (wp) revela que: a) existe uma grande variabilidade espacial do vapor d'agua na Amazonia, sendo as regioes central, norte e centro oeste as mais umidas, e a sudeste a mais seca; b) o ciclo diario e relativamente fraco, nao excedendo 10
   83:   em relacao a media diaria de Wp e; c) ocorre uma grande variabilidade interdiaria. O campo do transporte do vapor d'agua indica que, em geral, a componente de leste domina sobre a Amazonia como um todo. As variacoes interdiarias do fluxo de vapor de agua verticalmente integrado, aparentemente, estao associadas a passagem de sistemas meteorologicos, tais como linhas de instabilidade, pela regiao. Analise da divergencia do fluxo de vapor d'agua indica que em media a Amazonia e dominada pela convergencia de vapor d'agua (E  P), ou seja, essa regiao atua como um sumidouro de vapor d'agua. Entretanto, quando subdivide-se a regiao em duas sub-regioes, observa-se que no norte a evapotranspiracao e mais importante para precipitacao local do que a convergencia de vapor d'agua. No Sul, ocorre a situacao oposta, ou seja, a convergencia de vapor d'agua e maior que a evapotranspiracao. A evapotranspiracao total na regiao, durante o periodo estudado, estimada via residuo da equacao de balanco de vapor d'agua, foi de 108.7 mm
   91:  FDB-19920918
